titleStmt.title: John Custar to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6739

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Somerset Kentucky
July 21st 1865
To his Excelency
Thomas E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioner would respectfully represent to your Exilency That judgment was Confessed by him ^John Custar^ at the July Term 1865 of the Pulaski Circuit Court for $100,. for Keeping a Tipling House Your petitioner States that he ^said John Custar^ was an authorized army Sutler at Point Burnside and paid regular Army License The business was Carried in exclusive by within the limits of the Camp And your petitioner paid the regular taxes as sutler, and supposed that he was doing nothing but what was right and proper.
Under the Circumstances he prays you Exelency to remit the fine.
We Concur in the Statements and prayer of the foregoing petition.

Jno. S. VanWinkle
W McKee Fox
W. B. Moore
H. H. Pettus
W. D. Carpenter.
(over)
J. B. Love
G, W, Richardson
D. F. Bush

Pulaski Cir Ct
vs
John Custar $100.
Watson Ballew $100
Tipling
Temple Haynes & David L Clark $100,
Breach Peace
Remitted
4 Sept/65
